abstract: President Obama, Representative John Lewis and the Rev. Jesse Jackson spoke at the opening ceremony for the Martin Luther King Jr. Memorial.
snippet: President Obama, Representative John Lewis and the Rev. Jesse Jackson spoke at the opening ceremony for the Martin Luther King Jr. Memorial.
lead_paragraph: An expansive three-hour ceremony opened the memorial to Martin Luther King Jr. in Washington on Sunday, with speeches by President Obama and civil rights leaders like Representative John Lewis and the Rev. Jesse Jackson, and songs by performers like Aretha Franklin, my colleagues Helene Cooper and Sabrina Tavernise reported:

headline.main: A Grand Opening for the Martin Luther King Jr. Monument
